str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To be zealous, strive eagerly, desire very strongly.
From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From onoma; to name, i.e. Assign an appellation; by extension, to utter, mention, profess.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
From allos; another's, i.e. Not one's own; by extension foreign, not akin, hostile.
From a derivative of tithemi; something put down, i.e. A substruction.
